name: Pakistan Penal Code (Amendment) Ordinance, 2019
tagline: Further to amend the Pakistan Penal Code for the purpose of making offenses cognizable but subject to certain conditions
content:
PART I]     THE GAZETTE OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA., APRIL   8,  201 8 761 
 
 
 
 
ISLAMABAD,  SATURDAY , DECEMBER   28,  2019 
 
PART I  
 
Acts, Ordinances, President’s Orders and Regulations  
 
GOVERNMENT OF PAKIST AN 
MINISTRY OF LAW AND JUSTICE  
 
Islamabad, the 27th December , 201 9 
 
  No. F. 2(1)/201 9-pub.—The following Ordinance promulgate d on 26th 
December, 2019 by the President is hereby pub lished for general information: — 
 
ORDINANCE NO. XXV  OF 2019  
 
AN 
 
ORDINANCE  
 
further to amend the Pakistan Penal Code  
 
 WHEREAS  it is expedient further to amend the Pakistan Penal Code  
(Act XLV of 1860 ) for the purpose hereinafter appearing;  
 
 AND WHEREAS  the Senate and the National Assembly are not in session 
and the President of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan is satisfied that 
circumstances exist which render it necessary to take immediate action;  
 
(761) 
 
Price: Rs. 5.00 
 
[2032 (2019)/Ex. Gaz.].   
762 THE GA ZETTE OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA., DEC.   28,  201 9 [PART I 
 
  NOW, THEREFORE , in exercise of the power conferred by clause (1) of 
Article 89 of the Constitution of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan, the President is 
pleased to make and promulgate the following Ordinance: - 
 
 1. Short title and commencement. —(1) This Ordinance may be 
called the Pakistan Penal Code (Amendment) Ordinance, 2019.  
 
 (2) It shall come into force at once.  
 
 2. Substitution of section 462 -O, Act XLV of 1860. —In the Pakistan 
Penal Code (Act XLV of 1 860), for section 462 -O, the followin g shall be 
substituted, namely: — 
 
 “462-O. Cognizance. —The offences punishable under this Chapter shall 
be cognizable but the police shall not take cognizance of an offence 
under this Chapter except where information of  such offence is provided 
to the police in writing by a duly authorized officer (not below Grade 17) 
of the Government or by an officer of an equivalent grade of a 
Distribution Licensee, as the case may be. ”. 
 
 
  
 
DR. ARIF ALVI , 
President .
